header.div: Phase 1 of the interview is the easiest part of the test to prepare for. The advice below should help you to do this.

h1.p: Ways to improve your performance in Phase 1

ol.li: Arrange the main events of your life in order and find suitable linking phrases.
Think of questions the examiner might ask you about your schooldays / university life / work experience, and answer them.
Look at the answers below and you will see how each of them has been extended:
ol.p: Q:Where did you go to school?
A:I went to school near my home and I liked that because it meant my friends all lived in the same neighbourhood.
Q:What do you want to study at university?
A:I want to study civil engineering because we had a serious earthquake in my area and I became interested in the reinforcement of buildings.
Q:How do you travel to work?
A:I go to work by bus which is time-consuming and tiring, because buses are not regular and are often overcrowded.
ol.li: Think of ways you can extend the answers to questions by adding other bits of interesting information.
